API.ADK

Class API_ADK.Device

  • java.lang.Object
    • API.ADK.API_ADK.Device
  • Enclosing class:
    API_ADK

    public class API_ADK.Device
extends java.lang.Object
    Subclass Device. This class is used to communicate to a device.
    Author:
    hroesdiyono

    • Constructor Detail

      • API_ADK.Device

        private API_ADK.Device(byte inputListIndex)
        Private constructor, can only be called from inside the class. It initializes internal variables and objects.
        Parameters:
        inputListIndex - Input: The listIndex of API_ADK.intDeviceList value.

    • Method Detail

      • connectDevice

        public ReturnCode connectDevice()
        Initialize the object and open a connection to the device. This method should be called directly after creating the Device object.
        Returns:
        ReturnCode.SUCCESS, ReturnCode.OBJECT_IS_DEINITIALIZED, ReturnCode.INVALID_MAC_ID, ReturnCode.FAIL_GETTING_REMOTE_DEVICE, ReturnCode.FAIL_CREATING_BLUETOOTH_SOCKET, ReturnCode.FAIL_CLOSING_BLUETOOTH_SOCKET, ReturnCode.FAIL_OPENING_BLUETOOTH_SOCKET, ReturnCode.FAIL_OPENING_INPUTSTREAM, ReturnCode.FAIL_OPENING_OUTPUTSTREAM, or ReturnCode.FAIL_STARTING_RECEIVE_THREAD.

      • disconnectDevice

        public ReturnCode disconnectDevice()
        Close a connection to the device and deinitialize the Device object. This method will only return success if all the connection to the Controller and MessageChannel have been closed. After calling this method, the class object becomes unusable, any other methods will not be executed. Call this method at the end of the device communication.
        Returns:
        ReturnCode.SUCCESS, ReturnCode.CONTROLLER_INSTANCE_STILL_CONNECTED, ReturnCode.MESSAGE_CHANNEL_STILL_OPEN, or ReturnCode.FAIL_CLOSING_BLUETOOTH_SOCKET.

      • readDeviceInformation

        public ReturnCode readDeviceInformation(DeviceInformation deviceInformation)
        Return the information about the device, such as Firmware version, Protocol Version, and Hardware Number.
        Parameters:
        deviceInformation - Output: The information from the device, including version, protocol and hardware number information.
        Returns:
        ReturnCode.SUCCESS, ReturnCode.OBJECT_IS_DEINITIALIZED, ReturnCode.OBJECT_IS_NOT_INITIALIZED, ReturnCode.STRING_NOT_VALID, ReturnCode.FAIL_CONVERTING_TO_ARRAY, ReturnCode.FAIL_WRITING_TO_BLUETOOTH, ReturnCode.DEVICEINFORMATION_OBJECT_NOT_VALID, ReturnCode.FAIL_SEARCHING_STRING, ReturnCode.INVALID_RESPONSE, ReturnCode.FAIL_PARSING_HARDWARE_NUMBER, ReturnCode.UNKNOWN_DEVICE, ReturnCode.NO_VALID_HARDWARE_NUMBER, ReturnCode.WAITING_FOR_RESPONSE_TIMEOUT, ReturnCode.EXCEPTION_SLEEP_THREAD, or ReturnCode.NO_RESPONSE.

      • readErrorStatus

        public ReturnCode readErrorStatus(ErrorBuffer flag)
        Read the status of the CAN Controller and the status of the internal transmit and receive thread. This method could be called periodically to check the status of the CAN controller and the internal thread. If one of the internal thread is not running, there is a possibility that the connection to the device is no longer exist. If the threads are not running, try connecting to the device again. Eventhough the return code is not success, the thread status are valid.
        Parameters:
        flag - Output: The status of the controller and threads.
        Returns:
        ReturnCode.SUCCESS, ReturnCode.OBJECT_IS_DEINITIALIZED, ReturnCode.OBJECT_IS_NOT_INITIALIZED, ReturnCode.STRING_NOT_VALID, ReturnCode.FAIL_CONVERTING_TO_ARRAY, ReturnCode.FAIL_WRITING_TO_BLUETOOTH, ReturnCode.ERRORBUFFER_OBJECT_NOT_VALID, ReturnCode.FAIL_SEARCHING_STRING, ReturnCode.INVALID_RESPONSE, ReturnCode.WAITING_FOR_RESPONSE_TIMEOUT, ReturnCode.EXCEPTION_SLEEP_THREAD, or ReturnCode.NO_RESPONSE.

      • createControllerObject

        public API_ADK.Device.Controller createControllerObject(byte inputListIndex)
        Constructor of the Controller class. Since currently there is only one Controller for each Device, use the same listIndex as the Device Object. Call API_ADK.Device.Controller.initializeController(int,byte) or API_ADK.Device.Controller.initializeController(byte) directly after this method to initialize the controller. Call API_ADK.Device.Controller.deinitializeController() to deinitialize the Controller object.
        Parameters:
        inputListIndex - Input: The listIndex of API_ADK.intDeviceList value.
        Returns:
        API_ADK.Device.Controller object or null if it is already created.

      • createMessageChannelObject

        public API_ADK.Device.MessageChannel createMessageChannelObject(byte inputListIndex)
        Constructor of the MessageChannel class. Use the same listIndex as the Controller object. Call API_ADK.Device.MessageChannel.initializeMessageChannel() directly after this method to initialize the message channel. Call API_ADK.Device.MessageChannel.deinitializeMessageChannel() to deinitialize the MessageChannel object.
        The limitation of the object creation is 1 if the Hardware filter is used, and 128 if the Software filter is used. The object of the controller should be created before creating an object for the message channel and the controller should be stopped before creating MessageChannel object.
        Parameters:
        inputListIndex - Input: The listIndex of API_ADK.intDeviceList value.
        Returns:
        API_ADK.Device.MessageChannel object or null if the input is wrong or the number of the object is more than the limitation.
